page.title: 04Ecology continued
page.content: The Forest is now part of the Forest Ridges Area of outstanding natural beauty. But since the Forestry Commission planted a blanket of conifers a lot of its beauty is neither outstanding or natural. There are still many areas of natural woodland. Huge spreading beech trees majestic and magnificent.Oak is almost likened to weed, sweet chestnuts, birch willow holly and many more, interspereed with conifer plantions thrive for the benefit of man an beast. Holly is often grazed by the deer. Both roe and fallow deer are to be found and they are keen to progress from the shelter of forests to neighbouring fields and gardens and allotments to augment their diets. Deer tend to leap out in front of cars,and has also caused damange to young tree plantations by bucks in
